title: At Last, a Businessman Biden Can Blame for Raising Prices
sub_head: Billionaire Carl Icahn ramps up his campaign against McDonald’s.
body:
Billionaire Carl Icahnrecently told the Journal’s Cara Lombardo that he feels “really emotional” about animals. Assuaging his feelings could soon become very expensive for customers at McDonald’s .
The famous financier, who is worth an estimated $17 billion and is not a regular at any of the burger chain’s 40,000 worldwide locations, has been demanding that the restaurant’s pork suppliers give pregnant pigs more space in their crates. Now Mr. Icahn is escalating his campaign, which if successful is bound to put upward pressure on prices across the McDonald’s breakfast menu. Ms. Lombardo reports:
